Collision.name: Collision
Collision.description:
Detects collisions between a DOM element against other DOM elements or
Coords objects.

params.name: el
params.description: The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement.

params.name: colliders
params.description:
Can be a jQuery collection
 of HTMLElements or an Array of Coords instances.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: on_overlap_start
props.description:
Executes a function the first
   time each `collider ` is overlapped.

props.name: on_overlap_stop
props.description:
Executes a function when a
   `collider` is no longer collided.

props.name: on_overlap
props.description:
Executes a function when the
mouse is moved during the collision.

return.description: Collision instance.

Coords.name: Coords
Coords.description:
Creates objects with coordinates (x1, y1, x2, y2, cx, cy, width, height)
to simulate DOM elements on the screen.
Coords is used by Gridster to create a faux grid with any DOM element can
collide.

params.name: obj
params.description:
The jQuery HTMLElement or a object with: left,
top, width and height properties.

return.description: Coords instance.

Draggable.name: Draggable
Draggable.description:
Basic drag implementation for DOM elements inside a container.
Provide start/stop/drag callbacks.

params.name: el
params.description:
The HTMLelement that contains all the widgets
 to be dragged.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: items
props.description:
Define who will
    be the draggable items. Can be a CSS Selector String or a
    collection of HTMLElements.

props.name: distance
props.description:
Distance in pixels after mousedown
    the mouse must move before dragging should start.

props.name: limit
props.description:
Constrains dragging to the width of
    the container

props.name: offset_left
props.description:
Offset added to the item
    that is being dragged.

props.name: drag
props.description:
Executes a callback when the mouse is
    moved during the dragging.

props.name: start
props.description:
Executes a callback when the drag
    starts.

props.name: stop
props.description: Executes a callback when the drag stops.

return.description: Returns `el`.

params.name: el
params.description: The HTMLelement that contains all the widgets.

params.name: options
params.description:
An Object with all options you want to
       overwrite:

props.name: widget_selector
props.description:
Define who will
    be the draggable widgets. Can be a CSS Selector String or a
    collection of HTMLElements

props.name: widget_margins
props.description:
Margin between widgets.
    The first index for the horizontal margin (left, right) and
    the second for the vertical margin (top, bottom).

props.name: widget_base_dimensions
props.description:
Base widget dimensions
    in pixels. The first index for the width and the second for the
    height.

props.name: extra_cols
props.description:
Add more columns in addition to
    those that have been calculated.

props.name: extra_rows
props.description:
Add more rows in addition to
    those that have been calculated.

props.name: min_cols
props.description: The minimum required columns.

props.name: min_rows
props.description: The minimum required rows.

props.name: autogenerate_stylesheet
props.description:
If true, all the
    CSS required to position all widgets in their respective columns
    and rows will be generated automatically and injected to the
    `<head>` of the document. You can set this to false, and write
    your own CSS targeting rows and cols via data-attributes like so:
    `[data-col="1"] { left: 10px; }`

props.name: avoid_overlapped_widgets
props.description:
Avoid that widgets loaded
    from the DOM can be overlapped. It is helpful if the positions were
    bad stored in the database or if there was any conflict.

props.name: serialize_params
props.description:
Return the data you want
    for each widget in the serialization. Two arguments are passed:
    `$w`: the jQuery wrapped HTMLElement, and `wgd`: the grid
    coords object (`col`, `row`, `size_x`, `size_y`).

props.name: collision
props.description:
An Object with all options for
    Collision class you want to overwrite. See Collision docs for
    more info.

props.name: draggable
props.description:
An Object with all options for
    Draggable class you want to overwrite. See Draggable docs for more
    info.

classitems.description: Disable dragging.
classitems.name: enable

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Enable dragging.
classitems.name: enable

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Add a new widget to the grid.

params.name: html
params.description: The string representing the HTML of the widget.

params.name: size_x
params.description: The nº of rows the widget occupies horizontally.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The nº of columns the widget occupies vertically.

return.description:
Returns the jQuery wrapped HTMLElement representing.
 the widget that was just created.

classitems.description: Get the most left column below to add a new widget.
classitems.name: next_position

params.name: size_x
params.description: The nº of rows the widget occupies horizontally.

params.name: size_y
params.description: The nº of columns the widget occupies vertically.

return.description:
Returns a grid coords object representing the future
 widget coords.

classitems.description: Remove a widget from the grid.

params.name: el
params.description: The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement you want to remove.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Returns a serialized array of the widgets in the grid.
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: $widgets
params.description:
The collection of jQuery wrapped
 HTMLElements you want to serialize. If no argument is passed all widgets
 will be serialized.

return.description:
Returns an Array of Objects with the data specified in
 the serialize_params option.

classitems.description:
Returns a serialized array of the widgets that have changed their
 position.
classitems.name: serialize_changed

return.description:
Returns an Array of Objects with the data specified in
 the serialize_params option.

classitems.description:
Creates the grid coords object representing the widget a add it to the
mapped array of positions.

classitems.description:
Update in the mapped array of positions the value of cells represented by
the grid coords object passed in the `grid_data` param.

The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

params.name: value
params.description:
Pass `false` or the jQuery wrapped
 HTMLElement, depends if you want to delete an existing position or add
 a new one.

classitems.name: update_widget_position

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Remove a widget from the mapped array of positions.
classitems.name: remove_from_gridmap

params.name: grid_data
params.description:
The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

params.description:
The grid coords object representing the cells
 to update in the mapped array.

params.name: value
params.description:
The value to set in the specified
 position .

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Make widgets draggable.

params.description: original browser event

params.description: original browser event

params.description: prepared ui object.

classitems.description:
Executes the callbacks passed as arguments when a column begins to be
overlapped or stops being overlapped.

params.name: start_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a new column
 begins to be overlapped. The column is passed as first argument.

params.name: stop_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a column stops
 being overlapped. The column is passed as first argument.

classitems.name: on_overlapped_column_change

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
Executes the callbacks passed as arguments when a row starts to be
overlapped or stops being overlapped.

params.name: start_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a new row begins
 to be overlapped. The row is passed as first argument.

params.name: stop_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a row stops being
 overlapped. The row is passed as first argument.

classitems.name: on_overlapped_row_change

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description: Sets the current position of the player

params.name: start_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a new row begins
 to be overlapped. The row is passed as first argument.

params.name: stop_callback
params.description:
Function executed when a row stops being
 overlapped. The row is passed as first argument.

classitems.name: set_player

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

classitems.description:
See which of the widgets in the $widgets param collection can go to
a upper row and which not.
classitems.name: widgets_contraints

params.name: $widgets
params.description:
A jQuery wrapped collection of
HTMLElements.

return.description:
Returns a literal Object with two keys: `can_go_up` &
`can_not_go_up`. Each contains a set of HTMLElements.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in ascending way.

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) placing first the empty cells upper left.

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

classitems.description:
Sorts an Array of grid coords objects by column (representing the grid

classitems.name: sort_by_col_asc

params.name: widgets
params.description: Array of grid coords objects

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in descending way.

params.name: widgets

return.description: Returns the array sorted.

Sorts an Array of grid coords objects (representing the grid coords of
each widget) in descending way.

A jQuery collection of HTMLElements

classitems.description: Determines whether the player can move to a position above.

params.description:
The actual grid coords object of the
 player.

If the player can be moved to an upper row

The actual grid coords object of the
 widget we want to check.

If the widget can be moved to an upper row
 returns the row number, else returns false.

classitems.description:
Search a valid row for the widget represented by `widget_grid_data' in
the `upper_rows` array. Iteration starts from row specified in `min_row`.
classitems.name: get_valid_rows

params.name: widget_grid_data
params.description:
The actual grid coords object of the
 player.

params.name: upper_rows
params.description:
An array with columns as index and arrays
 of valid rows as values.

params.name: min_row
params.description: The upper row from which the iteration will start.

return.description:
Returns the upper row valid from the `upper_rows`
 for the widget in question.

classitems.description:
Move a widget to a specific row. The cell or cells must be empty.
If the widget has widgets below, all of these widgets will be moved also
if they can.

The jQuery wrapped HTMLElement of the
widget is going to be moved.

return.description: Returns the instance of the Gridster Class.

The jQuery object representing the widget
 you want to move.

into account the dimensions (`size_y` and `size_x` attrs. of the grid

The grid coords object that represents
 the widget.
